body_html:
I think I have a setup for development without rebuilding the wheel / re-installing it after every change. It does, however, require re-running the bazel build every time the C++ file change, or if any python files are added or deleted.

From the tensorflow repo root:

bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
mkdir _python_build
cd _python_build

ln -s ../bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/* .
ln -s ../tensorflow/tools/pip_package/* .
python setup.py develop

body:
I think I have a setup for development without rebuilding the wheel / re-installing it after every change. It does, however, require re-running the bazel build every time the C++ file change, or if any python files are added or deleted.

From the tensorflow repo root:

``` sh
bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
mkdir _python_build
cd _python_build

ln -s ../bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/* .
ln -s ../tensorflow/tools/pip_package/* .
python setup.py develop
```
